properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-25T04:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-24T22:31:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1793707973.2020
Area: Arrow Lakes - Slocan Lake, Boundary, West Kootenay, Kootenay Lake, East Kootenay - south including Cranbrook, East Kootenay - north including Invermere, Elk Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:16 pm MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a north-south line of severe thunderstorms just west of Rossland moving eastward at 30km/h, capable of producing very strong wind gusts, pea to dime size hail and heavy rain. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca.
Expires: 2020-06-25T01:15:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-24T22:17:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0937293508.2020
Area: West Kootenay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:25 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-25T00:57:31-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-24T23:25:31-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4192149560.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A trough of low pressure tracking across central Saskatchewan is triggering scattered thunderstorms this afternoon and evening. Some of these thunderstorms could be severe. This severe thunderstorm watch may be expanded eastwards as the event unfolds. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-25T07:59:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-24T21:14:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2964019114.2020

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and heavy rain. Maximum rainfall rates: locally 20 to 30 mm per hour in thunderstorms. Maximum wind gusts: near 80 km per hour in thunderstorms. Locations: northwestern New Brunswick. Time span: late this evening into the early overnight hours. Remarks: There remains as slight risk for severe thunderstorms to develop over eastern Maine this evening and move into northwestern parts of New Brunswick into the early overnight period. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-25T05:59:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-24T23:22:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0570351704.2020
Area: Woodstock and Carleton County, Edmundston and Madawaska County, western half of Restigouche County, Campbellton and eastern half of Restigouche County, Grand Falls and Victoria County

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:24 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This severe thunderstorm is currently located near Milestone and is tracking to the northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-25T01:23:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-24T22:25:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2352233480.2020

Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:05 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. Radar is tracking a strong thunderstorm just south of Arrowwood. This storm is moving to the east at 50 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:38 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a cluster of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This cluster of severe thunderstorms is currently located near Birmingham and is tracking to the northeast at 30 km/h. Quarter sized hail was recent reported near Neudorf. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
